title: Georgia Toffolo does not want to get involved in Rebekah Vardy drama
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Georgia ‘Toff’ Toffolo shut down Lorraine this morning after she questioned her about the Rebekah Vardy scandal with Coleen Rooney.

Toff made a guest appearance on the breakfast show to talk about Channel 4’s Celebrity Hunted, which she stars in alongside her pal Stanley Johnson.

However, everything was going so well until Lorraine asked the Queen of the jungle about the Rebekah Vardy drama with fellow wag Coleen Rooney.

Rebekah, who is married to Jamie Vardy has been accused by Colleen of selling stories about her to the press.

Advertisement

Advertisement

When asked what she thought about the feud, Toff quickly changed the subject as she didn’t ‘feel comfortable’ talking about.

When talking about I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here Lorraine probed: ‘Rebekah Vardy was in that year and she is your mate. She is heavily pregnant at the moment and we don’t know was right or wrong.’

The Made In Chelsea star, who looked a tad uncomfortable in her seat shut the topic down and responded: ‘It is tough she is a friend of mine, she’s pregnant and I’d rather not talk about it.’

Things got a bit awkward…. (Picture: Ken McKay/ITV/REX (10444563j)

Toff is on Celebrity Hunted with pal Stanley Johnson (Picture: ITV)

Viewers quickly took to social media to praise Georgia on how she handled the situation.

One tweeted: ‘Lorraine is so annoying fishing for gossip about Rebekah Vardy with Toff she isn’t that good an interviewer to get it out of her it’s all lovely, smashing everything is great same old lorraine .#lorraine’

Another said: ‘Well done Toff for shutting Lorraine down #lorraine bloody fishing for gossip…’

One added: ‘#Lorraine why do ya have to bring up the Vardy thing Mrs Krankie.’

Viewers did not hold back either (Picture: Twitter)

Many viewers took to social media to share their views (Picture: Twitter)

Talking about Celebrity Hunted Toff said she went on the run with her jungle pal and the Prime Minister’s dad Stanley Johnson.

Advertisement

Advertisement

She said: ‘ I absolutely adore him but we did the show in the Stan and Toff way and we somehow muddled through.

‘Stan is 79 and I am 24 so we took part because we knew it was important and we wanted to have a jolly.

‘His blonde hair had to go so we dyed it orange for show.’

Lorraine airs weekdays at 8.30am on ITV.
